attributes.action: Reverse the UK Government decision to drastically cut humanitarian aid to Yemen.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN chief, António Guterres, said reducing aid was a "death sentence". This decision is morally indefensible and damages the UK's reputation.
 
The situation in Yemen has been called the world's worst humanitarian crisis. An estimated 20 million people - two-thirds of the population - depend on humanitarian assistance. Some two million children are acutely malnourished.

Yemen has also seen a collapse of its health system, leaving it incapable of coping with the coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.background: We want the UK government to reverse the drastic cut in aid to Yemen which has been devastated by conflict. The aid is being reduced to roughly 50% of the £164m pledged last year whilst British ministers have refused to join the US in suspending arms sales to Saudi Arabia for offensive use in Yemen.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577527
